title: 'No details about incident or circumstances': MEA raises Indian student handcuff incident with US
content: The Ministry of External Affairs has taken up the detention of an Indian student in the US with the US embassy, according to sources. This follows an incident at Newark Airport where another Indian student was allegedly handcuffed and deported. The Indian Embassy in Washington DC and the Consulate in New York are seeking details.

title: Meghalaya murder: Sonam paid Rs 50k for killers’ travel; 2 accused have confessed, say police
content: Sonam Raghuvanshi allegedly paid her lover, Raj Kushwaha, Rs 50,000 to orchestrate the travel of him and three others to Shillong. The group tracked Sonam and her husband, Raja Raghuvanshi, during their honeymoon, with Sonam providing live locations.

title: In another step forward, India to host Chinese vice minister for talks
content: Chinese Vice Foreign Minister Sun Weidong is expected to visit India this week, marking the second high-level bilateral exchange this year. Discussions will likely encompass the normalization of relations following the Ladakh standoff, including the resumption of air services and people-to-people exchanges.

title: 'We are politicians, not saints': Ajit Pawar on joining NDA; says no NCP-SP merger
content: Ajit Pawar defended his faction's decision to join the NDA, stating that remaining in opposition was ineffective for addressing public grievances. He emphasized that the NCP's foundation remains rooted in secular ideology, despite aligning with the BJP-led alliance for development. Pawar also dismissed merger rumors with NCP (SP) and warned against anti-social activities by party members.

title: From earth to orbit: How Axiom-4 will reach the space station
content: Indian astronaut Shubhanshu Shukla, along with his crewmates, is set to launch on the Axiom-4 mission aboard a SpaceX Falcon-9 rocket on June 10 from Florida. Their 28-hour journey involves a meticulously planned sequence, from liftoff at Launch Complex 39A to docking with the International Space Station.

title: Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang: There’s a new programming language. It is called…
content: Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang recently highlighted AI's transformative potential, stating it democratizes programming by enabling users to instruct computers using natural language. He likened programming AI to guiding a person, emphasizing the ease with which AI can now perform complex tasks like writing poems.

title: Bengaluru stampede: Police held to account or made scapegoat? Debate’s still on
content: The suspension of Bengaluru's police commissioner and four other top officers following the M Chinnaswamy Stadium stampede has sparked controversy. A lack of contingency planning after RCB's qualification, coupled with unchecked social media promotion of a victory parade, contributed to the chaos.

title: In Delhi, Kerala, Tamil Nadu, educated middle-class put off childbirth
content: A UN report reveals India's declining fertility rate alongside barriers to reproductive freedom, creating a "high-low duality." While some states grapple with unintended pregnancies due to limited access and gender norms, others face below-replacement fertility driven by financial constraints and work-life conflicts. The focus should shift to fulfilling reproductive goals by empowering individuals to make informed choices.

title: Byju's sells US subsidiaries at steep discount
content: Byju's has sold its US subsidiaries, Epic and Tynker, through US bankruptcy proceedings as part of its asset liquidation after a financial downturn. Epic was acquired by TAL Education Group for $95 million, while CodeHS purchased Tynker for $2.2 million. These sales aim to help lenders recover losses from a $1.

title: Buying an iPhone in Dubai vs buying an iPhone in India? The major pros and cons
content: For Indian Apple enthusiasts, purchasing the iPhone 16 in Dubai presents a mixed bag. While Pro models offer potential cost savings, non-Pro versions might be pricier. Buying in Dubai means missing out on Indian bank offers and exchange discounts. FaceTime restrictions and potential import duties also need consideration, impacting the overall value proposition.

title: Delhi lawyer jailed: SC rejects mercy plea; told to surrender in two weeks
content: The Supreme Court has sentenced an advocate, Sanjay Rathod, to 18 months in jail for using abusive language to insult a female judicial officer in a Delhi courtroom back in 2015.

title: Proud of manner in which multi-party delegations put India's voice forward: PM Modi
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi met with all-party delegation members. They shared experiences from diplomatic missions. These missions communicated India's firm stance against Pakistan-linked terrorism. This followed Operation Sindoor. Delegations visited 33 international capitals. S Jaishankar praised their role. The teams included both ruling and opposition party leaders. This initiative showcased national unity against terrorism. Key leaders from various parties participated.

title: Sonam Raghuvanshi's secret life: End to MBA dreams, drawn into family business & a murder plot
content: Sonam Raghuvanshi, once aspiring to pursue an MBA, was asked to help in the family business, where she met Raj Kushwaha — now accused of helping her plot husband Raja’s murder during their honeymoon. The arranged marriage, seemingly accepted by Sonam, masked a chilling betrayal. Raj stayed behind, coordinating the crime, while trust within both families shattered.

title: Steve Jobs told Apple CEO Tim Cook: Never to stay married to .., skill he says he learnt late
content: Tim Cook credits Steve Jobs with teaching him the invaluable skill of rapidly changing his mind when presented with new evidence, a trait powered by emotional intelligence. Jobs's ability to shift direction and let go of pride influenced Cook and many others, including Jeff Bezos, Jony Ive, and Marc Benioff.

title: 'Until we got married': Kansas City Chiefs' Patrick Mahomes opens up about wife
content: Kansas City Chiefs' star quarterback Patrick Mahomes recently lauded his wife, Brittany, for her unwavering support since their high school days. He credited her for helping him evolve, both on and off the field. Mahomes highlighted Brittany's constant presence and influence, acknowledging her pivotal role in his personal and professional growth.

title: 'It’s Civil War': Marines in LA, lies flood socials - Is US democracy the target?
content: Los Angeles is gripped by protests following immigration raids and the deployment of federal troops, escalating tensions both on the streets and online. Disinformation campaigns are fueling the unrest, with doctored photos and conspiracy theories spreading rapidly across social media.

title: RCB to be sold after historic IPL 2025 win? Owner Diageo breaks silence
content: Diageo India has refuted media reports suggesting the sale of its Royal Challengers Bengaluru (RCB) IPL franchise, labeling them as speculative. Despite the denial, speculation persists, fueled by a Bloomberg report and a subsequent rise in United Spirits' shares. There are also murmurs about Diageo valuing the RCB franchise at around USD 2 billion.

title: All new ACs to come with minimum temp setting of 20 degrees C
content: India will soon mandate that all new air conditioners have a minimum temperature setting of 20 degrees Celsius and a maximum of 28 degrees. Power Minister Manohar Lal anticipates this move will save consumers ₹18,000-20,000 crore in three years by improving cooling efficiency and reducing power demand.

title: Mahomes credits wife Brittany; says her strength drives him; calls her his 'ultimate inspiration'
content: Patrick Mahomes credits his wife, Brittany, as the driving force behind his confidence and success. From high school sweethearts to an NFL power couple, their bond has remained unshakable. As Mahomes gears up for another season, he reveals that the strength guiding him through wins and losses begins at home with Brittany’s unwavering love and support by his side.

title: From Indore to Meghalaya to UP - and back to Meghalaya: Sonam's journey to crime scene
content: A honeymoon in Meghalaya turned tragic as Sonam Raghuvanshi is accused of orchestrating her husband Raja's murder. She allegedly conspired with her lover, Raj Kushwaha, and hired contract killers. Sonam surrendered in Uttar Pradesh, and is now being transported back to Meghalaya along with four other suspects to reconstruct the crime.

title: 'Like cat guarding milk': Rajnath slams UNSC for naming Pak in anti-terror panel
content: Defence minister Rajnath Singh has strongly criticised the UNSC's decision to appoint Pakistan as vice-chair of its counter-terrorism panel. "What is astonishing is that this Counter-Terrorism panel, was formed after the 9/11 terror attacks. Pakistan had sheltered the mastermind of the 9/11 attacks. This (decision) is akin to cat guarding the milk," Singh said.

title: Meghalaya murder case: Accused gets slapped at Indore airport by unknown man
content: The Meghalaya murder case has sparked national outrage after an Indore businessman was allegedly killed during his honeymoon. His wife, Sonam, is implicated, with evidence suggesting her involvement. As the accused were being transported, an unidentified man slapped one of them at Indore airport, highlighting the intense public sentiment surrounding the crime.

title: Los Angeles riots: City of Angels turns into downtown of rioters
content: Amidst growing protests against immigration raids, President Trump deployed federal forces to Los Angeles, raising concerns about authoritarian overreach. California officials condemned the move as a provocation, while incidents of violence and the treatment of journalists sparked international criticism. The crackdown on undocumented workers, targeting specific locations, has ignited fear and outrage within immigrant communities and drawn sharp political divisions.

title: Faith in flux: Why Islam is growing faster than Christianity; Hinduism holds steady
content: A recent Pew Research Center report reveals that while most major religious groups expanded between 2010 and 2020, Christianity's global share declined due to religious switching, despite a population increase. Islam experienced the fastest growth, driven by demographics and higher fertility rates. The religiously unaffiliated saw a significant rise, largely due to individuals leaving Christianity.

title: India-US trade deal: What officials discussed during the week-long deliberations
content: India and the United States are actively negotiating a bilateral trade agreement, aiming for completion by fall 2025. Discussions during the recent US delegation visit covered market access, digital trade, and customs facilitation. Both nations seek a mutually beneficial agreement, with the US focusing on digital commerce and India seeking tariff exemptions.

title: 'Unlike BJP or Left': Rahul asks K'taka govt to take responsibility for Bengaluru stampede
content: Rahul Gandhi and Mallikarjun Kharge have voiced their disapproval of the Karnataka government's involvement in RCB's IPL victory celebrations. They emphasized the importance of human lives and urged the government to be more responsive, contrasting it with the perceived inaction of BJP and Left governments in similar tragedies.

title: Missiles, fighter jets: Why China’s control on rare earth is giving US a headache
content: China's dominance in rare earth minerals, particularly samarium, poses a significant challenge to the US and its allies in replenishing military equipment. Export restrictions on these materials, vital for defence applications, are impacting weapon production. Despite ongoing trade negotiations, China is unlikely to ease these restrictions.

title: 'We want to give them a send-off': Virat Kohli, Rohit Sharma possibly playing their final series
content: Indian cricket icons Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma are set to feature in Australia's upcoming ODI series, potentially their last on Australian soil, according to Cricket Australia CEO Todd Greenberg. He highlighted a packed summer schedule, including matches in every Australian capital.

title: Austria school shooting: Assailant used two weapons; what we know about attacker
content: A devastating shooting at a high school in Graz, Austria, resulted in the deaths of ten people, including seven students and the suspected attacker. The incident prompted a swift response from special forces and the evacuation of the school. Authorities believe the student assailant acted alone and likely took his own life after opening fire, leaving several others seriously injured.

title: Australia or South Africa? WTC Final winner predicted
content: Astrologer Greenstone Lobo predicts South Africa will triumph over Australia in the World Test Championship final. Lobo's analysis, based on planetary positions and player horoscopes, suggests Australia's past successes have diminished their 'karmic quota.

title: Fresh caste survey in Karnataka; CM Siddaramaiah sets 90-day deadline
content: Karnataka's Chief Minister Siddaramaiah announced a fresh caste survey following concerns from various stakeholders regarding the 2015-16 report. The Congress high command advised considering all perspectives on the survey. The new enumeration aims to address apprehensions and will be completed within 90 days, potentially impacting reservation policies for Backward Communities.

title: String of explosions: Three killed after 16 bombs detonate in Colombia
content: Southwest Colombia experienced a series of coordinated attacks on Tuesday, resulting in three fatalities. Four car bombs and three additional explosive devices detonated across Cali, Corinto, El Bordo, and Jamundi. The explosions targeted police stations and municipal buildings, causing significant damage, including gutted buildings and wrecked storefronts. No group has claimed responsibility, but guerrillas are known to operate in the region.

title: Murder in hills of Meghalaya: The masterminds and three accused
content: A honeymoon trip turned deadly in Meghalaya as Indore businessman Raja Raghuvanshi was found murdered. His newlywed wife, Sonam Raghuvanshi, and her alleged lover, Raj Kushwaha, are accused of orchestrating the crime. Police have arrested five individuals, including Sonam and Raj, in connection with the murder, revealing a shocking conspiracy and a multi-state manhunt.

title: LA riots: Masked looters ransack Apple store, flee with merchandise - Video
content: Los Angeles is facing unrest as protests intensify against President Trump's immigration raids, leading to looting, including an Apple store incident. Trump has deployed National Guard troops and is escalating military presence, a move opposed by local officials and Governor Newsom. The protests were triggered by increased federal immigration enforcement, resulting in arrests and escalating tensions between the federal government and California leadership.

title: Gold vs Silver: Why silver may outperform gold; record-breaking rally likely
content: Silver prices have surged, hitting a 13-year high, fueled by a weakening dollar. Technical indicators suggest a potential breakout, with historical data showing strong returns after reaching new highs.

title: Bengals star Trey Hendrickson gets support from VP Vance amid contract buzz
content: Cincinnati Bengals' Trey Hendrickson's contract situation gains attention as Vice President JD Vance publicly supports him, calling him a 'generational talent.' Vance's endorsement highlights Hendrickson's value to the team, given his consistent performance with 17.5 sacks in each of the last two seasons. The Bengals face pressure to extend Hendrickson's contract, balancing financial management with retaining a key player.

title: When Nietzsche met God in the tunnels of Gaza
content: Omer had never been strictly religious. Like many secular Israelis, faith was a distant concept. He had completed his military service and was waiting tables to save for a post-army trip to South America. Yet, within days of his abduction, he began talking to God, making promises, and blessing the scraps of food he was given. It was faith, he would later recall, that kept him anchored—a source of strength in a reality with no clocks, no sunlight, and no certainty of survival.

title: LA riots: Trump gives 'if I didn't' justification on sending troops
content: Donald Trump claimed his decision to deploy troops in Los Angeles prevented chaos. He criticised California's leadership and permitting delays. Protests erupted over deportation policies. National Guard and Marines were deployed. State officials opposed federal intervention. A lawsuit was filed against the Trump administration. Mayor Karen Bass expressed confusion over the Marines' deployment. Protests continue in other cities as well.

title: 'A very good conversation': Shashi Tharoor on delegation meet with US VP Vance
content: Shashi Tharoor reported on the Indian delegation's "remarkable" meeting with US Vice President JD Vance, strategically positioned between Vance's calls with the Chinese President and German Chancellor. The delegation conveyed concerns and objectives related to India's counter-terrorism stance, receiving positive feedback.

title: Taylor Swift 'feels trapped' in NFL world: Insider says she’s overwhelmed
content: Insiders reveal that Taylor Swift and Travis Kelce's romance is facing strain as Kelce's rigorous NFL training clashes with Swift's glamorous lifestyle. Kelce's focus on strict fitness and early nights contrasts with Swift's fast-paced routine, leading to tension. While Swift remains supportive, she misses the spontaneity and fun they once shared as they navigate their demanding careers.

title: 'No travel demand': Airlines ask govt to waive user charges at Srinagar airport
content: Following a significant drop in tourism after the Pahalgam attack, airlines are urging the government to waive airport and security fees for Srinagar flights for a year. This request aims to financially incentivize travel and revive visitor numbers to Kashmir, where hotels and flights are experiencing drastically reduced demand and prices.

title: Austria school shooting: Video shows panic, fear as gunshots echo; 10 killed
content: A tragic school shooting in Graz, Austria, resulted in the deaths of 10 individuals, including the student perpetrator. Authorities suspect the gunman took his own life after the attack at BORG Dreierschützengasse school. A disturbing video capturing the sounds of gunfire has surfaced, prompting widespread shock and grief across Europe, with officials expressing condolences and emphasizing the need for school safety.

title: Gauri Khan rents apartment for staff, Sunita Ahuja on reason for fights with Govinda
content: Gauri Khan rents a Mumbai apartment for her staff during Mannat's renovation, while Karan Johar praises the grounded nature of Aryan and Suhana Khan. Sunita Ahuja reveals disagreements with Govinda stem from his career choices. Varun Grover accuses Sandeep Reddy Vanga of obnoxious behavior, and Deepika Padukone launches 75 badminton centers to honor her father's 70th birthday.

title: 'We will go deep into Pak': Jaishankar’s stern message over terror
content: External Affairs Minister S. Jaishankar issued a strong warning to Pakistan, stating India's readiness to conduct strikes within Pakistani territory in response to terrorist provocations. This declaration follows recent Indian military actions, including 'Operation Sindoor,' targeting terror camps after a deadly attack in Pahalgam.

title: Woman in black: How elusive Sonam resurfaced in Ghazipur after 16 days
content: Sahil Yadav helped Sonam Raghuvansi, who was distressed, at his dhaba. Sonam had gone missing from Meghalaya. She made a call to her brother. Sahil then called the police. Indore police alerted Ghazipur police. Sonam was taken to a One Stop Center. She was exhausted and slept. Police await Meghalaya team to record her statement.

title: 'Didn't kill my husband': What Sonam told UP cops, what she didn't
content: Sonam Raghuvanshi, missing for over two weeks, was found at a UP dhaba and arrested in connection with her husband Raja's murder during their honeymoon. Police allege she plotted the crime with lover Raj Kushwaha. While Sonam denies killing Raja, her silence on key details and missing jewellery deepen suspicion. Both families have demanded a CBI probe.

title: 'Result of Centre's callousness': Mamata blames govt for Pahalgam attack
content: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee criticized the Union government's "callousness" regarding the Pahalgam terror attack, accusing the BJP of politicizing the armed forces' valor. She questioned the absence of security personnel at the attack site while praising the forces' bravery during Operation Sindoor.

title: Our latest NBA mock draft: Back-and-forth on team need vs. best value
content: Best player available? Fill a need? We played out both strategies for 30 first-round slots in the draft.

title: Source: Buffs' Sanders dealing with health issue
content: Colorado coach Deion Sanders has been ill and away from the team recently, a source confirmed to ESPN on Tuesday.

title: Jets' Johnson fired up for Week 1 Rodgers reunion
content: Jets DE Jermaine Johnson said emotions will be high when he returns from his Achilles injury in Week 1 against former teammate Aaron Rodgers and the Steelers.

title: Diggs deflects 'personal' questions on boat video
content: Patriots receiver Stefon Diggs was mostly mum on questions about his viral boat video, telling reporters, "I don't talk about my personal life with people I don't know personally."

title: Wemby in midst of stay at Shaolin temple in China
content: Victor Wembanyama is in the midst of a 10-day stay at a Shaolin temple that welcomes visitors who wish to study Chan meditation, Shaolin Kung Fu and traditional Chinese medicine.

title: Browns' rookie QB Sanders unfazed by fewer reps
content: Browns rookie QB Shedeur Sanders, unfazed by the lack of first-team reps at minicamp, said he's focused on becoming as polished as possible and the best teammate.

title: Morris not worried about Cousins disrupting Penix
content: Falcons coach Raheem Morris does not expect Kirk Cousins' situation to be an issue for incumbent starter Michael Penix Jr.

title: Sources: Brewers add hard-throwing Misiorowski
content: The Brewers are calling up hard-throwing righty Jacob Misiorowski, who has been clocked as high as 103 mph this season in Triple-A, sources told ESPN, with the 23-year-old expected to join the rotation as soon as Thursday.

title: Rory admits to 81 in practice as Oakmont looms
content: Rory McIlroy said Tuesday that he shot 81 with two birdies on the final two holes at Oakmont Country Club during a scouting trip to the course last week.

title: ⚾ Ranking best MLB catches of the 2025 season
content: We've seen a number of outstanding snags in the outfield this season -- but this one might have already taken the title of best catch of 2025.

title: What do we really know about Michael Penix Jr.? Answering one big question for seven QBs entering Year 2
content: We answered key questions about quarterbacks from the 2024 draft class, including Penix, Caleb Williams and Jayden Daniels.

title: What all 30 MLB teams must do before the trade deadline
content: Is your team going to make a midsummer splash? Here's how the next few weeks could decide the season.

title: Still-too-early MLB All-Stars: Roster predictions, biggest debates
content: Freddie Freeman vs. Pete Alonso? Tarik Skubal vs. Kris Bubic? Here's our look at who will make it to Atlanta.

title: Who is Ellie the Elephant? A day with the New York Liberty icon
content: The Liberty's mascot elevates fandom in the WNBA. Trailing her was like hanging with the Beatles or Beyoncé

title: WNBA Power Rankings: Storm bounce back while Sky fall in Week 4 edition
content: Seattle returns to the top three while Chicago tumbles as the middle of the league finds its footing.

title: Parenting and game plans: Inside Jenny Boucek's extraordinary basketball journey to the Pacers
content: For decades, Boucek had professional dreams and personal ones -- and believed they were mutually exclusive. Now, as a mom and the first front-of-the-bench female assistant in the NBA, she's finally living both.

title: 'It's not a fair fight': Looking back at Tiger's historic 2000 U.S. Open championship
content: Woods arrived at Pebble Beach playing great golf and proceeded to lap the field, winning by 15 strokes. We look back at some of the highlights from one of the most dominant major performances in history.

title: From Kick-Six to the Lamar Leap: The top 25 college football plays of the millennium
content: Ahead of the 2025 season, our writers voted on the most significant and wildest plays of the past 25 years.

title: Is Mauricio Pochettino's style too slow for the USMNT?
content: This U.S. team is filled with pace, though Mauricio Pochettino is all about slow, deliberate play. It presents an obvious challenge: Can the USMNT get up to speed before the World Cup?

title: Yamal has the mentality of Messi, Ronaldo. He'll be even better in 2025-26
content: Lamine Yamal may have fallen short in the Champions League and Nations League, but that will only motivate the Barcelona and Spain star to get better.

title: Spalletti is out as Italy manager, and it's better late than never
content: It was clear after Euro 2024 that a coaching change was needed. After more dire displays, it finally came.

title: Sources: Chelsea's $57m Gittens bid rejected
content: Chelsea have had a €50 million ($57.1m) follow-up offer for winger Jamie Gittens rejected by Borussia Dortmund winger, sources told ESPN.

title: Mexico changes LA hotels over safety concerns
content: Mexico will change hotels in Los Angeles ahead of their Gold Cup match because of safety concerns amid the protests against immigration raids, a source told ESPN.

title: Socceroos seal World Cup berth with Saudi win
content: The Socceroos will head to a sixth consecutive World Cup after beating Saudi Arabia 2-1 in their final group game.

title: LaLiga chief Tebas: Club World Cup 'absurd'
content: LaLiga president Javier Tebas reiterated in an interview Monday that he considers the upcoming FIFA Club World Cup "completely absurd."

title: Man City sign France winger Cherki from Lyon
content: Manchester City have signed France international Rayan Cherki from Lyon, the Premier League club announced Tuesday.

title: Utd woes to Brazil call-up: Antony hit 'rock bottom'
content: Antony has described his return to the national team as more emotional than his first Brazil call-up after "hitting rock bottom" at Manchester United earlier this season.

title: Sources: Utd focus on Mbeumo, eye Gyökeres
content: Man United are prioritising signing Brentford forward Bryan Mbeumo before focusing on a potential move for Viktor Gyökeres, sources have told ESPN.

title: U.S. Soccer committee to evaluate college system
content: U.S. Soccer announced on Tuesday a committee that will evaluate and potentially overhaul the college soccer system.

title: Feel F1 performance for yourself: Take home Red Bull's RB17 for $6.7m
content: If you have $6.7 million to spare, you can experience F1 speeds yourself, with Red Bull's RB17 offering mind-bending performance to the public.

title: Daniel Suárez sees global potential as he leads NASCAR into Mexico
content: Suárez returns to race in Mexico for the first time in a decade, and he thinks this is just the beginning of NASCAR's world tour.

title: Divisional rankings: Nakatani, Opetaia win by KO, top their divisions
content: Junto Nakatani and Jai Opetaia won again, while Abdullah mason got closer to the top 10 at lightweight. Here are the latest ESPN divisional rankings.

title: UFC 316 clears the way for much-anticipated bantamweight showdowns
content: Two blockbuster fights seem imminent for the UFC 316 main card winners, while next steps for the losers are murkier.

title: Who won the men's transfer portal? Let's rank the 13 best teams
content: These teams got the best players from the transfer portal -- with some familiar faces in the mix for top spot.

title: Reliever stock watch: Giant value in San Francisco's pen
content: Everything fantasy baseball managers need to know about which closers should be added, dropped and more.

title: Kate Martin has arrived, Odyssey Sims thriving
content: Kate Martin has become a key scoring specialist for the Valkyries that could prove rewarding in fantasy while Odyssey Sims continues to break out in Los Angeles.

title: Stanley Cup Final odds: Bennett overtakes McDavid as Conn Smythe fave
content: Top ways to bet the series and props for the Stanley Cup Final between the Florida Panthers and Edmonton Oilers.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Gyökeres angry at Sporting's transfer fee demand
content: Sporting CP striker Viktor Gyökeres fears he is being priced out of a move to the Premier League. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: Ministry of Housing and Urban Affairs to move out of Nirman Bhawan by end of June
content: Nirman Bhawan also houses offices of the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare; an office memorandum says the new building will be equipped with basic office infrastructure including furniture, NIC connectivity, ICT facilities, etc.

title: Probation must be pillar of juvenile justice, say experts
content: At the national consultation, retired Supreme Court judge and Chairperson of the UN Internal Justice Council, Justice Madan B. Lokur lamented the neglect of probation in India’s juvenile justice system

title: Telangana Health Minister orders free treatment for toddler after parents die in road accident
content: According to doctors, the three-and-a-half-year-old girl has sustained a severe spinal injury and requires surgery

title: Science at the core of Vikshit Bharat vision, says Union Minister Dharmendra Pradhan at Global Young Scientists Summit
content: He said initiatives like Atal Tinkering Labs and the Anusandhan National Research Foundation Act reflect India’s commitment to nurturing grassroots innovation and supporting high-quality interdisciplinary research

title: No toilet for boys at this school since 1947, until a teacher built urinals from scratch
content: A solution to the issue came from the school’s physical director, Pilli Kashinath, who devised a low-cost innovation by repurposing five-litre plastic oil cans as urinals

title: Scientists uncover molecular clue to slow down reproductive aging
content: The team, using both live mouse models and cultured goat ovaries, found that reducing the activity of a cellular protein called ‘Cathepsin B’ (Cat B) helps preserve the ovarian reserve

title: Tourist activities launched at Shipki-La mountain pass in Himachal’s tribal Kinnaur district bordering China, says CM Sukhu
content: We have eased restrictions for the tourists to enjoy the beauty of Shipki-La and the tourism activities here would strengthen the economy of the local people along with boosting tourism in the region, he said

title: Chhattisgarh bids adieu to police officer killed in IED blast; 7-year-old son lights pyre
content: Girepunje was killed and two more officers were injured when an IED, allegedly planted by the Maoists, exploded near Dondra village in Sukma.

title: BBC report claims at least 82 killed in Maha Kumbh stampedes
content: State government has officially claimed 37 deaths; Samajwadi Party chief Akhilesh Yadav accuses Uttar Pradesh government of lying about the death toll

title: Consultations to appoint district chiefs begin as Cong. plans revival drive in Haryana
content: Anyone between 35 and 55 years of age and having been an active member of the party for the past five years can apply for the post

title: Central Pollution Control Board to decide on future of flue gas desulphurisation units: Power Minister
content: Flue gas desulphurisation units are an additional piece of equipment retro-fitted in thermal power plants to cut harmful sulphur dioxide emissions resulting from burning coal

title: How can Pakistan lead the fight against terror, asks Rajnath
content: Defence Minister questions UN decision to appoint Pakistan as vice-chair of its counter-terrorism committee; says the neighbouring country has sheltered 9/11 mastermind as well as terror organisations

title: Enforcement Directorate files supplementary prosecution complaint in ₹48,000-crore PACL case
content: Harsatinder Pal Singh Hayer allegedly played a key role in the illicit transfer and parking of funds amounting to ₹657.18 crore abroad

title: CPI(M)‘s M.A. Baby tours areas hit by shelling in Kashmir, expresses concern over ‘poor’ compensation
content: ‘The decision to grant ₹1.30 lakh as compensation is very meagre,’ the CPI(M) general secretary said, adding his party MPs would take up the issue of compensation in Parliament ‘very seriously’

title: Haryana police yet to respond to notice over professor’s arrest: NHRC
content: Ashoka University professor Ali Khan Mahmudabad was arrested for his remarks on Operation Sindoor in social media posts

title: Don’t withhold RTE funds over NEP row: Madras High Court to Centre
content: HC Bench says unable to issue a binding direction because T.N. government has already filed a suit before the Supreme Court; insists that Centre and State have concurrent obligations under RTE Act

title: Nitish Kumar has performed the last rites for law and order in Bihar: Lalu Prasad
content: Leaders of the ruling Janata Dal (United) and the Bharatiya Janata Party hit back at Mr. Prasad asking him not to give a sermon on law and order

title: CPI(M-L) likely to contest around 45 seats in Bihar Assembly election
content: Mahagathbandhan ally to launch ‘Badlo Sarkar-Badlo Bihar’ campaign; talks on seat sharing to begin soon

title: IPL stampede: Congress high command ‘reprimands’ CM, Dy. CM
content: Congress high command told both leaders “that there should be a clear-cut pro-people attitude on this issue” to make over the dented image of the government.

title: Acquiring multidisciplinary skills for expanding career opportunities is important, say experts
content: The speakers were speaking at a webinar on “Beyond Boundaries: How Multidisciplinary Learning Prepares for a Complex World”, organised jointly by the SRM Institute of Science and Technology and The Hindu.

title: India’s population reaches 146.39 crore, fertility rate drops below replacement level: UN report
content: The population is expected to grow to 170 crore before starting to dip in about 40 years, the report titled “State of the World Population 2025: The Real Fertility Crisis” says.

title: DGCA to conduct radio communication exam for pilots from November
content: In the past, the examination has been plagued by malpractices and arbitrariness, forcing many to either pay hefty bribes or take the exam overseas

title: Telangana CM Revanth Reddy meets Rahul Gandhi, portfolio reshuffle likely in the Cabinet
content: The Congress high command appears keen on ensuring that the allocation of portfolios aligns not just with governance priorities but also with political aspects in the wake of Congress party’s push for greater representation of downtrodden sections, party sources said

title: Stalin inaugurates libraries at bus termini, hospitals in Vellore, two other districts
content: The CM virtually launched the facilities set up at public spaces with high footfalls in the districts, including Ranipet, Tirupattur; they will function from 10 a.m. to 5 p.m. on all days, except Fridays

title: Won’t tolerate abuse of visas, violation of law, says U.S. Embassy
content: The remarks came a day after a video shared online showed an Indian student being restrained by security personnel at the Newark Liberty International Airport

title: No fire at Sakshi office in Eluru, say police
content: A furniture godown was damaged in fire and a case has been registered based on a complaint lodged by the store owner, says DSP

title: Caste data set to be re-enumerated in Karnataka to address concerns of some communities
content: Some caste groups, Veerashaivas and Lingayats most vociferously, have been demanding a re-enumeration, claiming that the old one was ‘unscientific’

title: 5 from Kerala die in road accident in Kenya
content: They were part of a group based in Qatar and were on a holiday when the bus in which they were travelling met with an accident on Ol Jororok-Nakuru Road in Nyandarua County

title: NMC yet to give permission for enhancement of medical seats; medical seat matrix delayed
content: The DME had submitted a proposal to the NMC in March 2025 for the enhancement of a total of 800 MBBS and 700 PG medical seats for the state. However, even after three months of submitting the request, permission has not been granted for the seat enhancement.

title: App-based gig platform exclusively for women launched
content: The mobile app-based platform — SITHA — creates a dignified and flexible earning ecosystem, offering verified home services, community-based gigs, digital consulting, artisanal products and more, the developers said

title: Shiv Sena (UBT) open to alliance with MNS for Maharashtra’s benefit, says Sanjay Raut
content: There is no political ego in it, says the Rajya Sabha MP, as speculation grows about a reconciliation between Uddhav and Raj Thackeray

title: Deal sternly, quickly with crimes against women, ganja gangs, CM tells police
content: Expressing anguish over murder and rape of two girls in erstwhile Anantapur district, Chandrababu Naidu directs police officials to ensure that the culprits get severe punishment

title: LDF, UDF pull out all the stops in bypoll campaign in Nilambur
content: LDF is going all out for its candidate M. Swaraj. As many as 10 Ministers campaigned for him on Tuesday.  Campaign for UDF candidate Aryadan Shoukath is gaining momentum with top leaders leading the charge

title: TNCC completes constitution of 70% of village committees, says  Selvaperunthagai
content: We are now establishing booth committees, which are the heart of the party, says the TNCC president, who met party national president Mallikarjun Kharge and general secretary K. C. Venugopal in New Delhi on Monday

title: Burning cargo vessel along Kerala coast has flammable solids, liquids
content: According to the cargo manifest, there are 157 containers with hazardous substances on the ship. They are flammable liquids, solids, spontaneously combustible solids, and substances either in liquid or solid form that can damage human health

title: National Security Guard defused two drones laden with explosives at Jammu airport after Operation Sindoor: NSG Director General
content: The NSG has been deployed for the first time in a Left Wing Extremism-affected area in Gadchiroli district of Maharashtra, amid the Union government’s aim to end Maoism by March 2026

title: Chief Minister M.K. Stalin launches Chennai Book Park in Central Metro station
content: The facility, set up at a cost of ₹1.85 crore, has a collection of 15,000 books published by the Tamil Nadu Textbook and Educational Services Corporation and others. Based on the reception, others book parks will be opened at places such as the Alandur Metro station, says official

title: In shipwreck, best practice is to register case against ship owner, says ex-Shipping Secretary
content: He says the case can be pursued both legally and through negotiations, citing an incident involving MSC in Maharashtra

title: Proud of the way multiparty delegations put forward India’s voice: PM
content: Members shared their experiences with the PM, with the Central government having already praised the work of the seven delegations comprising over 50 persons, mostly current MPs

title: At least five Qatar-based Indian nationals die in road accident in Kenya
content: The identity of the dead is yet to be verified, while 27 are injured and admitted to various hospitals in Kenya

title: Spike in leptospirosis cases worries Health department in Kerala
content: In 2022, the State recorded 5,315 probable and confirmed cases of leptospirosis and 290 deaths (both probable and confirmed). The very next year, 5,186 cases and 282 deaths were recorded. In 2024, the number of cases jumped to 5,980 and the deaths to  394. This year too, the picture looks quite alarming, with 1,451 cases and 74 deaths recorded till June 9.

title: Farmers pay tributes to those killed in 2008 Haveri police firing
content: They stage a demonstration at Hosamani Siddappa Circle in Haveri blocking the road for some time and raising various other demands

title: West Bengal Assembly unanimously passes resolution lauding armed forces
content: Mamata Banerjee says that during the conflict “there was an opportunity to capture Pakistan-occupied-Kashmir”;  Opposition leader Suvendu Adhikari asks why reference to “Operation Sindoor” was absent in the Assembly resolution

title: New Osmania General Hospital scheduled to be ready in 30 months at estimated cost of ₹1,667 crore
content: The main hospital structure will rise to 12 floors, including two basement levels for parking, covering a total built-up area of 23.42 lakh square feet

title: Pupil Stabs To Death Assistant At French School
content: French President Emmanuel Macron on Tuesday condemned a "senseless wave of violence" after a teaching assistant stabbed by a 15-year-old pupil outside a school in the east of the country died of her wounds.

title: India's Defence Sector Is Becoming "Trusted Global Exporter": Rajnath Singh
content: Defence Minister Rajnath Singh on Tuesday said during the 11 years of Prime Minister Narendra Modi's "bold and visionary" leadership, India's defence sector has transformed remarkably from a largely import-driven model to becoming a "trusted global e

title: Teenager Gets Injured While Shooting 'Reel' Of Fake Suicide
content: The craze of creating reels' or short videos for social media almost cost a Nepalese teenager his life on Tuesday as he got injured while staging a fake suicide by hanging in Maharashtra's Ahilyanagar district on Tuesday morning.

title: Man Convicted In 1994 Graduation Party Massacre In US Arrested In Los Angeles Raids
content: A 49-year-old Vietnamese national, convicted in a notorious gang-related mass shooting, is among several illegal immigrants arrested by ICE in a weekend raid across Los Angeles that triggered violent protests.

title: "He Used To Call Her Didi": Raj Kushwaha's Sister On Meghalaya Murder
content: Raja Raghuvanshi's body was found in a gorge in Meghalaya on June 2 and the police say his wife, Sonam, had planned the murder because she was in love with Raj Kushwaha, an employee in her family-run business.

title: Same Murder, Different Routes: How Sonam, Killers Escaped From Meghalaya
content: The murder occurred on May 23, the body was found on June 2, and the whereabouts of the wife were unknown. There was speculation that the woman, who had come with her husband for her honeymoon, may have also been attacked or kidnapped.

title: Curfew Relaxed In 5 Districts As Situation Improves In Manipur
content: With the improvement of the situation in Manipur, the district administrations of five valley districts relaxed the indefinite curfew on Tuesday, an official said.

title: "So Proud": Daughter Of Officer Behind Pak Ceasefire Talks Praises "Cool" Father
content: The Uttam Yudh Seva Medal is a high wartime military honour awarded for exceptional service during conflict or hostilities.

title: Goodbye Lenin? Russians Flock To See Bolshevik Leader's Tomb Before Closure
content: Russians are flocking to catch what some fear could be a final glimpse of the embalmed body of Bolshevik leader Vladimir Lenin before his tomb on Moscow's Red Square, long a place of pilgrimage for communists, closes for repairs until 2027.

title: "Sent Big Message": PM On Opposition Leaders In Anti-Terror Outreach Teams
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi today underlined that sending so many people from the opposition in anti-terror outreach delegation "sends a big message from India" to the world, sources have told NDTV, as he met the returning members at his residence.

title: US Slaps Sanctions On El Chapo's Sons, Announces $10 Million Reward
content: The US government on Monday sanctioned the fugitive sons of drug lord Joaquin 'El Chapo' Guzman, and announced a $10 million reward for information leading to their arrests.

title: A Murder, 3 Grieving Mothers: How Meghalaya Killing Has Affected Families
content: What began as a dreamy honeymoon for an Indore-based couple in Meghalaya has unravelled into a sordid saga of murder and betrayal, leaving three families heartbroken.

title: 'Shubhanshu Shukla Will Follow In Kalpana Chawla's Steps': Ex-Astronaut
content: Shubhanshu Shukla, India's second astronaut, is all set to lift off for the International Space Station tomorrow on the Axiom 4 mission. The historic journey will begin from the Kennedy Space Centre in Florida, United States.

title: Honeymoon Murder Highlights: Sonam Raghuvanshi Offered Rs 20 Lakh For Murder, Say Sources
content: Meghalaya Honeymoon Murder Case Highlights: Sonam Raghuvanshi had offered Rs 4 lakh to hired killers for the murder of her husband Raja Raghuvanshi, sources said, adding she later raised the amount to Rs 20 lakh.

title: "Slogans Not Enough. We Are Not Saints": Ajit Pawar On Joining BJP Alliance
content: Justifying his decision to join hands with the BJP, Nationalist Congress Party (NCP) chief Ajit Pawar on Tuesday said he and his colleagues were not "saints" who could remain in the opposition and be content with protesting and shouting slogans.

title: "Cat Named Daisy Has Driven Everyone Crazy": High Court Cancels "Frivolous Case"
content: Karnataka High Court on Tuesday quashed criminal case filed against a man accused of stealing a cat named 'Daisy'.

title: 4-Day Closed-Door Talks On India-US Trade Deal Conclude. What Was Discussed
content: Significant progress was made in the latest round of talks between India and the United States over a possible interim trade deal expected within weeks

title: What Is Meta's 'Superintelligence' That Zuckerberg Is Hiring Personally For
content: AGI, while still a theoretical concept, refers to AI that can outperform humans across a broad range of cognitive tasks. Many experts believe such capabilities may be decades awayif they are possible at all.

title: Syria Mandates Full Body Swimwear For Women On Public Beaches
content: Syria's new Islamist authorities said on Tuesday that women going to public beaches must wear burkinis or other "decent" clothes that cover the body, giving some private venues an exemption.

title: Missile Launched From Yemen Toward Israel, Says Israeli Military
content: The Israeli military said on Tuesday that it was working to intercept a missile launched from Yemen toward Israel, hours after Israel deployed its navy to hit targets in the Yemeni Red Sea port of Hodeidah.

title: NBA Finals betting: Thunder huge title favorites after blowout win
content: Oklahoma City Thunder beat the Indiana Pacers 123-107 in game 2 . the Thunder moved from -325 to -550 to win the title while the Pacers dropped down from +260 to +400 . in the finals MVP race, Shai Gilgeous-Alexander (-550) is still the favorite by a wide margin .

title: Overheard at the NHL draft combine: Draft wild cards, surprises ... and the X factor team
content: scouts and executives alike marveled at what could be an unpredictable first round . the upcoming draft is expected to be announced on july 27 and 28 . "there are maybe 16 or 18 players I could see going in the top 10," says one .

title: Our final college softball rankings: How do the top 25 teams stack up after the WCWS?
content: the 2025 college softball season is over, with the longhorns taking home their first national title . here is the final ESPN.com/USA Softball Collegiate top 25 ranking . the rankings are based on each team's final record .
